Conny Presich

Conny Presich was born in Vienna in 1991. Growing up in an urban environment meant she had limited possibilities to explore nature. But it did instill in her an impulse to express herself culturally through music, prose, theatre, photography, and film. Filmmaking became her primary focus as she studied audiovisual media at St.Pölten for a year before beginning her studies at the Vienna Film Academy in 2010. Conny met Jack and Angus through an old school friend of hers who went on to study with Angus at Oxford. Having briefed the pair before their expedition to Mongolia on camerawork and documentary making she went on to become the editor of the resulting footage; creating Blue Horizons' debut film 'A Journey with Nomads'. In 2013 Conny took a year off film making to travel the Americas. This dramatic change in lifestyle augmented her ability to construct an illusory digital view from her own experiences. Sharing this view with other people and creating it for them, is what she considers as the main impact and interest film can have. This is why editing has been the discipline she has chosen to specialise in. Currently, Conny lives at the foot of the Rax Alpes about an hour to the south of Vienna. Being able to live and work there is a challenge for someone who always has lived in the city but it also helps to foster her adventurous spirit and ultimately her ability to tell a story through film.
